adverbs.description: desperately (comparative more desperately, superlative most desperately)

entries.meaning: In a desperate manner; without regard to danger or safety; recklessly.
examples: She desperately grabbed at the nearby branches as she heard the branch she was standing on start to snap.
I could desperately do with some coffee right now.
The race for silver medal was desperately close, they needed a photo finish to separate the runners.
